At that time, the five people saw the Buddha coming from afar;
They discussed among themselves, saying:
The one who comes for the sake of pleasure is the son of Gautama;
He has given up his original aspiration, his methods have failed and he has not accomplished anything.
It is not necessary to rise up to greet him, nor should we treat him with respect;
His original vow has been broken, so it is not appropriate to revere him.
Having made such a resolution, they sat down tightly without rising.
In the time it takes to speak, the Buddha arrived;
Suddenly, without realizing it, they went against their original agreement.
Like the earth spirit, they were lifted up and made to rise.
Some welcomed and received his robes;
Some took his alms bowl and set out seats.
With such forms they respectfully served the Buddha;
Yet they still could not abandon worldly jesting words.
The Buddha then said to them:
This is not proper for a practitioner of the Way, and it is not suitable in front of the Buddha to be arrogant and lacking in reverence.
